trans-unit.source: Crops a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
CroppedBitmap implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.
Property changes can occur only during object initialization.

Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.

CroppedBitmap objects created by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Int32Rect%29> constructor are automatically initialized, and properties cannot be changed.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect%2A> property of this class to define the area of the bitmap that is to be cropped.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.

To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> class that has the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source*> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect*>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> instance.
Occurs when source is .
Signals the start of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> is currently being initialized.
BeginInit has already been called.
-or- The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> has already been initialized.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Signals the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and EndInit calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>. -or- The EndInit method is called without first calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit*>.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets the source for the bitmap.

You can chain a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> to another <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by setting the Source property of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> to the appropriate <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
For more information about chaining, see [How to: Chain BitmapSource Objects Together](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The source for the bitmap.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.Source*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> with a SourceRect set to <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty%2A?displayProperty=fullName> will render the entire image.
A rectangle that is not fully within the bounds of the bitmap will not render.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to.
The default is <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect*> dependency property.
To be added.
